text:
The page http://demo.wyona.org/lenya/oscom/introduction.html is displayed in a 
wrong way using MSIE 6.0.

The column "This Publication" is shifted to the right (partially out of the 
screen).

Changing the MSIE "Text Size" to something smaller than Medium removes the 
effect. Changing it to something larger increases the effect.
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
Possible solutions without losing the publication column:

(1) line breaks in the source code fragment
(2) publication column on the left side (still requires horiz. scrolling)
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
To be more precise, there are several aspects of the problem.

The problem only concerns the part of the page below the head. The head itself 
is flawless.

1. the right side of the column and the right side of the head above are not 
aligned

2. the total width of the lower part of the page depends on the Text Size

3. the total width of the lower part of the page is not adjusted to the browser 
width
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
andreas@apache.org
text:
>1. the right side of the column and the right side of the head
>above are not aligned

I wouldn't change this. This way, even when the lower part of the
page is too wide, the Lenya logo is still visible. What we could do
is put a <div> around the bar and the lower part to make the bar as
wide as the lower part.

>2. the total width of the lower part of the page depends
>on the Text Size

This is a matter of HTML and won't fix.

>3. the total width of the lower part of the page is not
>adjusted to the browser width

This is a matter of HTML and won't fix.

creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
text:
Ok, please add the <div> tag and then assign this issue to me. I will then 
sometime try to find a solution for the "won't fix" aspects.
All the aspects of the problem are solved, great!
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de
